com.box.androidlib
Class BoxSynchronous

java.lang.Object
  com.box.androidlib.BoxSynchronous

public class BoxSynchronous
extends java.lang.Object

Use this class to execute requests synchronously against the Box REST API. Full details about the Box API can be found at http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923956/ApiOverview . You must have an OpenBox application with a valid API key to use the Box API. All methods in this class are executed in the invoking thread, and therefore are NOT safe to execute in the UI thread of your application. You should only use this class if you already have worker threads or AsyncTasks that you want to incorporate the Box API into. Otherwise, it is recommended that you use Box.

Author:
developers@box.net

public static BoxSynchronous getInstance(java.lang.String apiKey)
Returns an instance of BoxSynchronous with the given API key. You must have an API key to execute requests against the Box API. If you do not already have an API key, create an OpenBox application at https://www.box.net/developers/

Parameters:
apiKey - The API key of your OpenBox application
Returns:
An instance of BoxSynchronous

                                               throws java.io.IOException
This method is used to get a tree representing all of the user's files and folders. Executes API action get_account_tree: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923929/ApiFunction_get_account_tree

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String)
folderId - The ID of the root folder from which the tree begins. If this value is 0, the user's full account tree is returned.
params - An array of strings. Possible values are Box.PARAM_ONELEVEL, Box.PARAM_NOFILES, Box.PARAM_NOZIP, Box.PARAM_SIMPLE.
Returns:
the response parser used to capture the data of interest from the response. See the doc for the specific parser type returned to see what data is now available. All parsers implement getStatus() at a minimum.

search

public final SearchResponseParser search(java.lang.String authToken,
                                         java.lang.String query,
                                         java.lang.String sort,
                                         int page,
                                         int perPage,
                                         java.lang.String direction,
                                         java.lang.String[] params)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
This method gets a list of items that would normally be obtained through search. Executes API action search: http://developers.box.net/w/page/22888693/ApiFunction_search

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String)
query - The text to search for
sort - The method in which the results may be sorted. Set to Box.SORT_RELEVANCE, Box.SORT_NAME, Box.SORT_DATE or Box.SORT_SIZE
page - The page number, which begins on page 1. This coincides with the per_page parameter
perPage - The number of search results to display per page
direction - Set to either Box.DIRECTION_ASC or Box.DIRECTION_DESC
params - Array of string params that can include Box.SEARCH_PARAM_SHOW_DESCRIPTION and/or Box.SEARCH_PARAM_SHOW_PATH
Returns:
the response parser used to capture the data of interest from the response. See the doc for the specific parser type returned to see what data is now available. All parsers implement getStatus() at a minimum.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Can be thrown if there is no connection, or if some other connection problem exists.

getUpdates

                                              long beginTimeStamp,
                                              long endTimeStamp,
                                              java.lang.String[] params)
                                       throws java.io.IOException

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String)
beginTimeStamp - a unix_timestamp of the earliest point in time to obtain an update (the time of the oldest update you want to display)
endTimeStamp - a unix_timestamp of the latest point in time to obtain an update
params - array of parameters. Currently, the only supported parameter is Box.PARAM_NOZIP
Returns:
the response parser used to capture the data of interest from the response. See the doc for the specific parser type returned to see what data is now available. All parsers implement getStatus() at a minimum.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Can be thrown if there is no connection, or if some other connection problem exists.

publicShare

public final PublicShareResponseParser publicShare(java.lang.String authToken,
                                                   java.lang.String type,
                                                   long targetId,
                                                   java.lang.String password,
                                                   java.lang.String shareMsg,
                                                   java.lang.String[] emails)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
This method makes a file or folder shareable, and may initiate sharing through Box email notifications. Executes API action public_share: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923943/ApiFunction_public_share

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String)
type - The type of item to be shared. Set to Box.TYPE_FILE or Box.TYPE_FOLDER
targetId - The file_id or folder_id of the item
password - The password to protect the folder or file.
shareMsg - A message to be included in a notification email.
emails - An array of emails to notify users about the newly shared file or folder.
Returns:
the response parser used to capture the data of interest from the response. See the doc for the specific parser type returned to see what data is now available. All parsers implement getStatus() at a minimum.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Can be thrown if there is no connection, or if some other connection problem exists.

privateShare

public final java.lang.String privateShare(java.lang.String authToken,
                                           java.lang.String type,
                                           long targetId,
                                           java.lang.String message,
                                           java.lang.String[] emails,
                                           boolean notify)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Privately shares a file or folder with other users. Executes API action private_unshare: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923942/ApiFunction_private_share

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String)
type - The type of item to be shared. Set to Box.TYPE_FILE or Box.TYPE_FOLDER
targetId - The file_id or folder_id of the item
message - A message to be included in a notification email
emails - An array of emails to notify users about the newly shared file or folder.
notify - Set to true to send a notification email to users. If set to false, notifications will not be sent
Returns:
the status code returned from Box API
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Can be thrown if there is no connection, or if some other connection problem exists.

addToMyBox

public final java.lang.String addToMyBox(java.lang.String authToken,
                                         long fileId,
                                         java.lang.String publicName,
                                         long folderId,
                                         java.lang.String[] tags)
                                  throws java.io.IOException
This method copies a file that publicly shared by another individual and into a user's a designated folder in the user's Box. Executes API action http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923920/ApiFunction_add_to_mybox

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String)
fileId - The id of the file you wish to copy.
publicName - The unique public name of the shared file that you wish to copy.
folderId - The folder_id of the folder to which you will copy the item.
tags - A List of tags to apply to the file when copied into the user's own folder. Can be set to null if there are no tags.
Returns:
the status code returned from Box API
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Can be thrown if there is no connection, or if some other connection problem exists.

download

public final DefaultResponseParser download(java.lang.String authToken,
                                            long fileId,
                                            java.io.File destinationFile,
                                            java.lang.Long versionId,
                                            FileDownloadListener listener,
                                            Handler handler)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Download a file. Uses the download API as described here: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923951/ApiFunction_Upload-and-Download

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String)
fileId - The file_id of the file to be downloaded
destinationFile - A java.io.File resource to which the downloaded file will be written. Ensure that this points to a valid file-path that can be written to.
versionId - The version_id of the version of the file to download. Set to null to download the latest version of the file.
listener - A file download listener. You will likely be interested in callbacks FileDownloadListener.onProgress(long) and FileDownloadListener.onComplete(String)
handler - The handler through which FileDownloadListener.onProgress will be invoked.
Returns:
a response handler
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Can be thrown if there is no connection, or if some other connection problem exists.

upload

public final FileResponseParser upload(java.lang.String authToken,
                                       java.lang.String action,
                                       java.io.File file,
                                       java.lang.String filename,
                                       long destinationId,
                                       FileUploadListener listener,
                                       Handler handler)
                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                       java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                       java.io.IOException
Upload a file from the device to a folder at Box. Uses the upload API as described here: http://developers.box.net/w/page/12923951/ApiFunction_Upload-and- Download}

Parameters:
authToken - The auth token retrieved through getAuthToken(String)
action - Set to Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD or Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY
file - A File resource pointing to the file you wish to upload. Make sure File.isFile() and File.canRead() are true for this resource.
filename - The desired filename on Box after upload (just the file name, do not include the path)
destinationId - If action is Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_UPLOAD, then this is the folder id where the file will uploaded to. If action is Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_OVERWRITE or Box.UPLOAD_ACTION_NEW_COPY, then this is the file_id that is being overwritten, or copied.
listener - A file upload listener. You will likely be interested in callbacks FileUploadListener.onProgress(long) and FileUploadListener.onComplete(com.box.androidlib.DAO.BoxFile, String)
handler - The handler through which FileUploadListener.onProgress will be invoked.
Returns:
the response parser used to capture the data of interest from the response. See the doc for the specific parser type returned to see what data is now available. All parsers implement getStatus() at a minimum.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Can be thrown if there is no connection, or if some other connection problem exists.
java.io.FileNotFoundException - File being uploaded either doesn't exist, is not a file, or cannot be read
java.net.MalformedURLException - Make sure you have specified a valid upload action
